id.description: The focus obfuscated gaia id of the user.

hd.description: The hosted domain e.g. example.com if the user is Google apps user.

verified_email.description: Boolean flag which is true if the email address is verified.

birthday.description: The user's birthday. The year is not present.

picture.description: URL of the user's picture image.

scope.description: The space separated list of scopes granted to this token.

issued_to.description: To whom was the token issued to. In general the same as audience.

verified_email.description: Boolean flag which is true if the email address is verified. Present only if the email scope is present in the request.

audience.description: Who is the intended audience for this token. In general the same as issued_to.

expires_in.description: The expiry time of the token, as number of seconds left until expiry.

email.description: The email address of the user. Present only if the email scope is present in the request.

access_type.description: The access type granted with this token. It can be offline or online.

name: oauth2

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/plus.me.description: Know who you are on Google

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.description: View basic information about your account

title: Google OAuth2 API

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

description: Lets you access OAuth2 protocol related APIs.
